name: Kumquat-Rosemary Marmalade with Goat Cheese
recipeIngredient: 12 ounces kumquats (about 25), rinsed, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds, seeds removed
1 sprig fresh rosemary, plus 1/4 teaspoon fresh rosemary, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: In a saucepan, combine the water and sugar and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar has dissolved. Add the sliced kumquats, black peppercorns, and rosemary sprig. Stir well, and then simmer until kumquats are starting to become translucent and liquid has reduced to a syrup, 10 to 15 minutes.
When done, turn off the heat and remove the rosemary sprig. Add the chopped rosemary and stir well. Set aside and allow to cool, about 15 minutes.
Spread 1 1/2 tablespoons of the goat cheese on top of each slice of toast. Add some of the marmalade and serve.
